metadata.title: CVE-2018-6621 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
The decode_frame function in libavcodec/utvideodec.c in FFmpeg through 3.2allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out of array read)via a crafted AVI file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-6621` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:3.4.2-2build2
libavcodec-extra - 7:3.4.2-2build2
libavcodec-extra58 - 7:3.4.2-2build2
libavcodec58 - 7:3.4.2-2build2
libavdevice58 - 7:3.4.2-2build2
libavfilter-extra - 7:3.4.2-2build2
libavfilter-extra7 - 7:3.4.2-2build2
libavfilter7 - 7:3.4.2-2build2
libavformat58 - 7:3.4.2-2build2
libavresample4 - 7:3.4.2-2build2
libavutil56 - 7:3.4.2-2build2
libpostproc55 - 7:3.4.2-2build2
libswresample3 - 7:3.4.2-2build2
libswscale5 - 7:3.4.2-2build2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:3.4.2-2build2').
